Name: Amazon Rekognition
Features: Content Moderation: Detects potentially unsafe, inappropriate, or unwanted content across images and videos.; Face compare and search: Determines the similarity of a face against another picture or from a private image repository.; Face detection analysis: Detects faces appearing in images and videos and recognize attributes such as open eyes, glasses, and facial hair for each.; Labels: Detects objects, scenes, activities, landmarks, dominant colors, and image quality.; Custom labels : Detects custom objects such as brand logos using automated machine learning (AutoML) to train models with as few as 10 images.; Text detection: Extracts skewed and distorted text from images and videos of street signs, social media posts, and product packaging.; Celebrity recognition: Identifies well-known people to catalog photos and footage for media, marketing, and advertising.; Video segment detection : Detects key segments in videos, such as black frames, start or end credits, slates, color bars, and shots.; Streaming Video Events detection: Detects objects such as packages, pets, or people in real-time from live video streams.; Identity verification: Pre-trained facial recognition and analysis capabilities that can be added to user onboarding and authentication workflows to verify opted-in users' identity online.
Deployment Types: Software as a Service (SaaS), Cloud, or Web-Based

Name: IBM watsonx.ai
Description: Watsonx.ai is an enterprise-ready next-generation AI studio for machine learning and generative AI, powered by foundation models. With the watsonx.ai studio, AI builders — including data scientists, application developers and business analysts can build, train, validate, tune and deploy traditional machine learning and new generative AI capabilities.  Watsonx.ai is designed to support collaboration and scalability in AI application development and can be deployed across hybrid environments.
Features: Foundation Model Library with IBM and select open-source models from Hugging Face; Prompt Lab to experiment with foundation models and build prompts for various use cases and tasks; Tuning Studio to tune foundation models with labeled data; Data Science and MLOps tools to build machine learning models automatically with model training, development, visual modeling, and synthetic data generation
Deployment Types: On-premise, Software as a Service (SaaS), Cloud, or Web-Based
Top Competitors: Amazon SageMaker,Azure OpenAI Service, andVertex AIare common alternatives for IBM watsonx.ai.

Features: Foundation Model Library with IBM and select open-source models from Hugging Face; Prompt Lab to experiment with foundation models and build prompts for various use cases and tasks; Tuning Studio to tune foundation models with labeled data; Data Science and MLOps tools to build machine learning models automatically with model training, development, visual modeling, and synthetic data generation

Name: Quantum Boost
Description: Quantum Boost is an advanced online platform that uses artificial intelligence to reach set targets through the fewest possible experiments.
Features: Faster than DoE: Quantum Boost uses AI algorithms to ensure targets are achieved in the fewest amount of experiments possible.; Flexible project development: Ability to update project definitions without losing all the knowledge gained so far.; User-friendliness: The platform is crafted to guide users through the complexities of experimental design, making it accessible for both beginners and seasoned experts.; Analytics: Offers immediate insights into experimental data to support better strategic decisions about products.; Quantum Bot: Discovers suitable replacements for ingredients or finds the perfect chemicals to use for specific applications. The Quantum Boost’s chatbot possesses knowledge of over 80,000+ materials.
Deployment Types: Software as a Service (SaaS), Cloud, or Web-Based

Name: Amazon Rekognition
Features: Content Moderation: Detects potentially unsafe, inappropriate, or unwanted content across images and videos.; Face compare and search: Determines the similarity of a face against another picture or from a private image repository.; Face detection analysis: Detects faces appearing in images and videos and recognize attributes such as open eyes, glasses, and facial hair for each.; Labels: Detects objects, scenes, activities, landmarks, dominant colors, and image quality.; Custom labels : Detects custom objects such as brand logos using automated machine learning (AutoML) to train models with as few as 10 images.; Text detection: Extracts skewed and distorted text from images and videos of street signs, social media posts, and product packaging.; Celebrity recognition: Identifies well-known people to catalog photos and footage for media, marketing, and advertising.; Video segment detection : Detects key segments in videos, such as black frames, start or end credits, slates, color bars, and shots.; Streaming Video Events detection: Detects objects such as packages, pets, or people in real-time from live video streams.; Identity verification: Pre-trained facial recognition and analysis capabilities that can be added to user onboarding and authentication workflows to verify opted-in users' identity online.
Deployment Types: Software as a Service (SaaS), Cloud, or Web-Based
